summary.long: Proverbs is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The proverbs of Solomon, the son of David, king of Israel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To know wisdom and instruction,
    to perceive the words of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to receive the instruction of wisdom,
    justice, judgment, and equity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to give subtlety to the simple,
    to the young man knowledge and discretion—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a wise man will hear and will increase learning,
    and a man of understanding will attain wise counsel,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to understand a proverb and the interpretation,
    the words of the wise and their riddles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge,
    but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, hear the instruction of your father,
    and do not forsake the teaching of your mother;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they will be a garland of grace on your head,
    and chains about your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if sinners entice you,
    do not consent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
let us swallow them up alive as the grave,
    and whole, as those who go down into the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
we will find all kinds of precious possessions;
    we will fill our houses with spoil;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
cast in your lot among us,
    let us all have one purse”—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my son, do not walk in the way with them,
    keep your foot from their path;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for their feet run to evil
    and make haste to shed blood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely in vain the net is spread
    in the sight of any bird.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lie in wait for their own blood;
    they lurk secretly for their own lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So are the ways of everyone who is greedy of gain,
    which takes away the life of its owners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom cries out in the street;
    she utters her voice in the markets.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She cries at the corner of the streets, in the openings of the gates;
    she speaks her words in the city, saying:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“How long, you simple ones, will you love simplicity?
    For the scorners delight in their scorning,
    and fools hate knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because I have called and you refused,
    I have stretched out my hand and no man regarded,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
because you neglected all my counsel,
    and would have none of my reproof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also will laugh at your calamity;
    I will mock when your fear comes,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when your fear comes as desolation
    and your destruction comes as a whirlwind,
    when distress and anguish come upon you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then they will call on me, but I will not answer;
    they will seek me early, but they will not find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they hated knowledge
    and did not choose the fear of the Lord,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they would have none of my counsel
    and despised all my reproof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore they will eat of the fruit of their own way,
    and be filled with their own devices.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the turning away of the simple will slay them,
    and the prosperity of fools will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But whoever listens to me will dwell safely,
    and will be secure from fear of evil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you will receive my words,
    and hide my commandments within you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so that you incline your ear to wisdom,
    and apply your heart to understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
yes, if you cry out for knowledge,
    and lift up your voice for understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
if you seek her as silver,
    and search for her as for hidden treasures,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
then you will understand the fear of the Lord,
    and find the knowledge of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord gives wisdom;
    out of His mouth come knowledge and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lays up sound wisdom for the righteous;
    He is a shield to those who walk uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He keeps the paths of justice,
    and preserves the way of His saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will understand righteousness and judgment
    and equity, and every good path.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When wisdom enters your heart,
    and knowledge is pleasant to your soul,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
discretion will preserve you;
    understanding will keep you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to deliver you from the way of the evil man,
    from the man who speaks perverse things,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
from those who leave the paths of uprightness
    to walk in the ways of darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who rejoice to do evil,
    and delight in the perversity of the wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
whose ways are crooked,
    and who are devious in their paths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to deliver you from the immoral woman,
    even from the seductress who flatters with her words,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
who forsakes the guide of her youth,
    and forgets the covenant of her God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For her house leads down to death,
    and her paths to the departed spirits;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
none who go to her return again,
    nor do they take hold of the paths of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So you may walk in the way of good men
    and keep the paths of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the upright will dwell in the land,
    and the innocent will remain in it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but the wicked will be cut off from the earth,
    and the transgressors will be rooted out of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not forget my teaching,
    but let your heart keep my commandments;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for length of days and long life
    and peace will they add to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
so you will find favor and good understanding
    in the sight of God and man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Trust in the Lord with all your heart,
    and lean not on your own understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in all your ways acknowledge Him,
    and He will direct your paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
    fear the Lord and depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It will be health to your body,
    and strength to your bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Honor the Lord with your substance,
    and with the first fruits of all your increase;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so your barns will be filled with plenty,
    and your presses will burst out with new wine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, do not despise the chastening of the Lord,
    nor be weary of His correction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for whom the Lord loves He corrects,
    even as a father the son in whom he delights.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Happy is the man who finds wisdom,
    and the man who gets understanding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for her benefit is more profitable than silver,
    and her gain than fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is more precious than rubies,
    and all the things you may desire are not to be compared with her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Length of days is in her right hand,
    and in her left hand riches and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her ways are ways of pleasantness,
    and all her paths are peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of her,
    and happy is everyone who retains her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord by wisdom has founded the earth;
    by understanding He has established the heavens;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
by His knowledge the depths are broken up,
    and the clouds drop down the dew.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, let them not depart from your eyes—
    keep sound wisdom and discretion;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so they will be life to your soul
    and grace to your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then you will walk safely in your way,
    and your foot will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you lie down, you will not be afraid;
    yes, you will lie down and your sleep will be sweet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not be afraid of sudden terror,
    nor of trouble from the wicked when it comes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord will be your confidence,
    and will keep your foot from being caught.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not withhold good from those to whom it is due,
    when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say to your neighbor,
    “Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give it,”
    when you have it with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not devise evil against your neighbor,
    seeing he dwells securely by you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not strive with a man without cause,
    if he has done you no harm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not envy the oppressor,
    and choose none of his ways;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the perverse is an abomination to the Lord,
    but His secret counsel is with the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The curse of the Lord is on the house of the wicked,
    but He blesses the habitation of the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely He scorns the scornful,
    but He gives favor to the humble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise will inherit glory,
    but shame will be the legacy of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, O children, the instruction of a father,
    and attend to know understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I give you good precepts;
    do not forsake my teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I was my father’s son,
    tender and the only beloved in the sight of my mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Get wisdom! Get understanding!
    Do not forget it, nor turn away from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not forsake her, and she will preserve you;
    love her, and she will keep you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is principal; therefore get wisdom.
    And with all your getting, get understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Exalt her, and she will promote you;
    she will bring you honor, when you embrace her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She will place on your head an ornament of grace;
    a crown of glory she will deliver to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, my son, and receive my sayings,
    and the years of your life will be many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have taught you in the way of wisdom;
    I have led you in right paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When you walk, your steps will not be hindered,
    and when you run, you will not stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take firm hold of instruction, do not let her go;
    keep her, for she is your life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not enter the path of the wicked,
    and do not go in the way of evil men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Avoid it, do not travel on it;
    turn from it and pass on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they do not sleep unless they have done mischief;
    and their sleep is taken away unless they cause some to fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For they eat the bread of wickedness
    and drink the wine of violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the path of the just is as the shining light,
    that shines more and more unto the perfect day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is as darkness;
    they do not know at what they stumble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, attend to my words;
    incline your ear to my sayings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not let them depart from your eyes;
    keep them in the midst of your heart;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for they are life to those who find them,
    and health to all their body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep your heart with all diligence,
    for out of it are the issues of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put away from you a deceitful mouth,
    and put perverse lips far from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your eyes look right on,
    and let your eyelids look straight before you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ponder the path of your feet,
    and let all your ways be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not turn to the right or to the left;
    remove your foot from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, attend to my wisdom,
    and bow your ear to my understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that you may regard discretion,
    and that your lips may keep knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the lips of an immoral woman drip as a honeycomb,
    and her mouth is smoother than oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But her end is bitter as wormwood,
    sharp as a two-edged sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her feet go down to death,
    her steps take hold of Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She does not ponder the path of life;
    her ways are unstable, and she does not know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear me now therefore, O children,
    and do not depart from the words of my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remove your way far from her,
    and do not go near the door of her house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest you give your honor to others,
    and your years to the cruel;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
lest strangers be filled with your wealth,
    and your labors go to the house of a stranger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and you mourn at the last,
    when your flesh and your body are consumed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and say, “How I have hated instruction,
    and my heart despised reproof!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I have not obeyed the voice of my teachers,
    nor inclined my ear to those who instructed me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was almost in utter ruin
    in the midst of the congregation and assembly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Drink waters out of your own cistern,
    and running waters out of your own well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should your fountains be dispersed abroad,
    streams of water in the streets?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them be only your own,
    and not for strangers with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let your fountain be blessed,
    and rejoice with the wife of your youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Why should you, my son, be intoxicated by an immoral woman,
    and embrace the bosom of a seductress?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ways of man are before the eyes of the Lord,
    and He ponders all his goings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His own iniquities entrap the wicked himself,
    and he is snared in the cords of his sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will die for lack of instruction,
    and in the greatness of his folly he will go astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, if you put up a security for your friend,
    if you have shaken hands with a stranger,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you are snared with the words of your mouth;
    you are taken with the words of your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Give no sleep to your eyes,
    nor slumber to your eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deliver yourself as a doe from the hand of the hunter,
    and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go to the ant, you sluggard!
    Consider her ways and be wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which, having no guide,
    overseer, or ruler,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
provides her bread in the summer,
    and gathers her food in the harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will you sleep, O sluggard?
    When will you arise out of your sleep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet a little sleep, a little slumber,
    a little folding of the hands to sleep—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so will your poverty come upon you like a stalker,
    and your need as an armed man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wayward person, a wicked man,
    walks with a perverse mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
perversity is in his heart,
    he devises mischief continually, he sows discord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore his calamity will come suddenly;
    in a moment he will be broken without remedy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These six things the Lord hates,
    yes, seven are an abomination to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a proud look,
        a lying tongue,
        and hands that shed innocent blood,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a heart that devises wicked imaginations,
        feet that are swift in running to mischief,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
a false witness who speaks lies,
        and he who sows discord among brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep your father’s commandment,
    and do not forsake the instruction of your mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them continually upon your heart,
    and tie them around your neck.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the commandment is a lamp, and the law is light;
    and reproofs of instruction are the way of life,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to keep you from the evil woman,
    from the flattery of the tongue of a seductress.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not lust after her beauty in your heart,
    nor let her allure you with her eyelids.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by means of a harlot a man is reduced to a piece of bread,
    and the adulteress will prey upon his precious life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man take fire in his bosom,
    and his clothes not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can one walk upon hot coals,
    and his feet not be burned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So he who goes in to his neighbor’s wife;
    whoever touches her will not be innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Men do not despise a thief if he steals
    to satisfy himself when he is hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if he is found, he will restore sevenfold;
    he will give all the substance of his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But whoever commits adultery with a woman lacks understanding;
    he who does it destroys his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wound and dishonor will he get,
    and his reproach will not be wiped away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For jealousy is the rage of a man;
    therefore he will not spare in the day of vengeance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not regard any ransom,
    nor will he rest content, though you give many gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My son, keep my words,
    and lay up my commandments within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Keep my commandments and live,
    and my teaching as the apple of your eye.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bind them on your fingers;
    write them on the tablet of your heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,”
    and call understanding your kinswoman,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that they may keep you from the immoral woman,
    from the seductress who flatters with her words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For at the window of my house
    I looked through my casement,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
and saw among the simple ones,
    I discerned among the youths,
    a young man void of understanding,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
passing through the street near her corner;
    and he went the way to her house
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
in the twilight, in the evening,
    in the black and dark night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And there a woman met him,
    with the attire of a harlot, and subtle of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She is loud and stubborn;
    her feet do not abide in her house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now she is without, now in the streets,
    and lies in wait at every corner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So she caught him, and kissed him;
    and with an impudent face said to him:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have peace offerings with me;
    this day have I paid my vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I came out to meet you,
    diligently to seek your face, and I have found you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have decked my bed with coverings of tapestry,
    with carved works, with fine linen of Egypt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have perfumed my bed
    with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Come, let us take our fill of love until the morning;
    let us solace ourselves with love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my husband is not at home;
    he has gone on a long journey;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has taken a bag of money with him,
    and will come home at the day appointed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With her enticing speech she caused him to yield,
    with the flattering of her lips she seduced him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He went after her straightway,
    as an ox goes to the slaughter,
or as a fool to the correction of the stocks,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until a dart struck through his liver.
As a bird hastens to the snare,
    he did not know that it would cost him his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Listen to me now therefore, O children,
    and attend to the words of my mouth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
do not let your heart turn aside to her ways,
    do not go astray in her paths;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for she has cast down many wounded,
    and many strong men have been slain by her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her house is the way to Sheol,
    going down to the chambers of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Does not wisdom cry out,
    and understanding lift up her voice?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She stands on the top of high places,
    by the way in the places of the paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She cries out at the gates,
    at the entry of the city, at the entrance of the doors:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“To you, O men, I call,
    and my voice is to the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O you simple, understand wisdom,
    and you fools, be of an understanding heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, for I will speak of excellent things,
    and from the opening of my lips will be right things;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for my mouth will speak truth,
    and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the words of my mouth are in righteousness;
    there is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are all plain to him who understands,
    and right to those who find knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Receive my instruction, and not silver,
    and knowledge rather than choice gold;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for wisdom is better than rubies,
    and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I, wisdom, dwell with prudence,
    and find out knowledge and discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom;
    I am understanding, I have strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me kings reign,
    and princes decree justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By me princes rule,
    and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I love those who love me,
    and those who seek me early will find me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches and honor are with me,
    yes, enduring riches and righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My fruit is better than gold,
    yes, than fine gold, and my revenue than choice silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I lead in the way of righteousness,
    in the midst of the paths of justice,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I may cause those who love me to inherit wealth,
    and I will fill their treasuries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord possessed me in the beginning of His way,
    before His works of old.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was set up from everlasting,
    from the beginning, before there was ever an earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When there were no depths, I was brought forth,
    when there were no fountains abounding with water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before the mountains were settled,
    before the hills I was brought forth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
while as yet He had not made the earth or the fields,
    or the first dust of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When He prepared the heavens, I was there,
    when He drew a circle on the face of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when He established the clouds above,
    when He strengthened the fountains of the deep,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
when He gave to the sea His decree,
    that the waters should not pass His commandment,
when He appointed the foundations of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
rejoicing in the habitable part of His earth,
    and my delights were with the sons of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Now therefore listen to me, O you children,
    for blessed are those who keep my ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear instruction, and be wise,
    and do not refuse it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessed is the man who hears me,
    watching daily at my gates,
    waiting at the posts of my doors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For whoever finds me finds life,
    and will obtain favor of the Lord;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but he who sins against me wrongs his own soul;
    all those who hate me love death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom has built her house,
    she has hewn out her seven pillars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
she has killed her beasts, she has mixed her wine,
    she has also furnished her table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She has sent out her maidens,
    she cries out from the highest places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.”
    As for him who wants understanding, she says to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Come, eat of my bread,
    and drink of the wine which I have mixed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Forsake foolishness and live,
    and go in the way of understanding.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who reproves a scorner gets shame for himself,
    and he who rebukes a wicked man gets hurt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not reprove a scorner, lest he hate you;
    rebuke a wise man, and he will love you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser;
    teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom,
    and the knowledge of the Holy One is understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by me your days will be multiplied,
    and the years of your life will be increased.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If you are wise, you will be wise for yourself,
    but if you scorn, you alone will bear it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish woman is clamorous;
    she is simple, and knows nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she sits at the door of her house,
    on a seat in the high places of the city,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to call those who pass by
    who go right on their way:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Whoever is simple, let him turn in here.”
    And as for him who lacks understanding, she says to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Stolen waters are sweet,
    and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he does not know that the dead are there,
    and that her guests are in the depths of the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proverbs of Solomon.
A wise son makes a glad father,
    but a foolish son is the grief of his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Treasures of wickedness profit nothing,
    but righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will not allow the soul of the righteous to famish,
    but He casts away the desire of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He becomes poor who deals with a slack hand,
    but the hand of the diligent makes rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gathers in summer is a wise son,
    but he who sleeps in harvest is a son who causes shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Blessings are on the head of the just,
    but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The memory of the just is blessed,
    but the name of the wicked will rot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart will receive commandments,
    but a prating fool will fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks uprightly walks surely,
    but he who perverts his ways will be known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who winks with the eye causes sorrow,
    but a prating fool will fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of a righteous man is a well of life,
    but violence covers the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hatred stirs up strife,
    but love covers all sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the lips of him who has understanding wisdom is found,
    but a rod is for the back of him who is void of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wise men store up knowledge,
    but the mouth of the foolish is near destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city;
    the destruction of the poor is their poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The labor of the righteous tends to life,
    the fruit of the wicked to sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who keeps instruction is in the way of life,
    but he who refuses reproof errs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who hides hatred has lying lips,
    and he who spreads slander is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the multitude of words sin is not lacking,
    but he who restrains his lips is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the just is as choice silver;
    the heart of the wicked is worth little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous feed many,
    but fools die for lack of wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of the Lord makes rich,
    and He adds no sorrow with it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do mischief is like sport to a fool,
    but a man of understanding has wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the wicked will come upon him,
    but the desire of the righteous will be granted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the whirlwind passes, so is the wicked no more,
    but the righteous has an everlasting foundation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As vinegar to the teeth and as smoke to the eyes,
    so is the sluggard to those who send him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord prolongs days,
    but the years of the wicked will be shortened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hope of the righteous will be gladness,
    but the expectation of the wicked will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the Lord is strength to the upright,
    but destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous will never be removed,
    but the wicked will not inhabit the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of the just brings forth wisdom,
    but the perverse tongue will be cut out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable,
    but the mouth of the wicked speaks what is perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false balance is abomination to the Lord,
    but a just weight is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When pride comes, then comes shame;
    but with the humble is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The integrity of the upright will guide them,
    but the perverseness of transgressors will destroy them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Riches do not profit in the day of wrath,
    but righteousness delivers from death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the upright will direct his way,
    but the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteousness of the upright will deliver them,
    but transgressors will be taken by their schemes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish,
    and the hope of unjust men perishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous is delivered out of trouble,
    and the wicked comes in his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor,
    but through knowledge the just will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices;
    and when the wicked perish, there is shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted,
    but it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is void of wisdom despises his neighbor,
    but a man of understanding holds his peace.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A talebearer reveals secrets,
    but he who is of a faithful spirit conceals the matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where there is no counsel, the people fall;
    but in the multitude of counselors there is safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who puts up a pledge for a stranger will suffer for it,
    and he who hates being a pledge is secure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gracious woman retains honor,
    but ruthless men retain riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The merciful man does good to his own soul,
    but he who is cruel troubles his own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked works a deceitful work,
    but to him who sows righteousness will be a sure reward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As righteousness tends to life,
    so he who pursues evil pursues it to his own death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who are of a perverse heart are abomination to the Lord,
    but such as are upright in their way are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though be assured, the wicked will not be unpunished,
    but the posterity of the righteous will be delivered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a jewel of gold in a swine’s snout,
    so is a fair woman who is without discretion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the righteous is only good,
    but the expectation of the wicked is wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who scatters, yet increases;
    and there is one who withholds more than is right, but it leads to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The generous soul will be made rich,
    and he who waters will be watered also himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The people will curse him who withholds grain,
    but blessing will be upon the head of him who sells it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who diligently seeks good procures favor,
    but he who seeks mischief, it will come to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who trusts in his riches will fall,
    but the righteous will flourish as a branch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who troubles his own house will inherit the wind,
    and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fruit of the righteous is a tree of life,
    and he who wins souls is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the righteous will be recompensed in the earth,
    how much more the wicked and the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever loves instruction loves knowledge,
    but he who hates reproof is brutish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man obtains favor of the Lord,
    but a man of wicked devices will He condemn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will not be established by wickedness,
    but the root of the righteous will not be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband,
    but she who brings shame is as rottenness in his bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the righteous are right,
    but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of the wicked are, “Lie in wait for blood,”
    but the mouth of the upright will deliver them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked are overthrown, and are not,
    but the house of the righteous will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be commended according to his wisdom,
    but he who is of a perverse heart will be despised.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is lightly esteemed and has a servant is better
    than he who honors himself and lacks bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man regards the life of his animal,
    but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who tills his land will be satisfied with bread,
    but he who follows vain persons is void of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked covet the plunder of evil men,
    but the root of the righteous yields fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips,
    but the just will come out of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth,
    and the recompense of a man’s hands will be rendered to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a fool is right in his own eyes,
    but he who listens to counsel is wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s wrath is presently known,
    but a prudent man covers shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who speaks truth shows forth righteousness,
    but a false witness deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who speaks like the piercings of a sword,
    but the tongue of the wise is health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The truthful lip will be established forever,
    but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deceit is in the heart of those who imagine evil,
    but to the counselors of peace is joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There will no evil happen to the just,
    but the wicked will be filled with mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lying lips are abomination to the Lord,
    but those who deal truly are His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man conceals knowledge,
    but the heart of fools proclaims foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hand of the diligent will rule,
    but the slothful will be put to forced labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Heaviness in the heart of man makes it droop,
    but a good word makes it glad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous is a guide to his neighbors,
    but the way of the wicked leads them astray.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The slothful man does not roast that which he took in hunting,
    but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the way of righteousness is life,
    and in its pathway there is no death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son heeds his father’s instruction,
    but a scoffer does not listen to rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man will eat well by the fruit of his mouth,
    but the soul of the transgressor will eat violence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who guards his mouth preserves his life,
    but he who opens wide his lips will have destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the sluggard desires, and has nothing;
    but the soul of the diligent will be made fat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A righteous man hates lying,
    but a wicked man is loathsome and comes to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness keeps him who is upright in the way,
    but wickedness overthrows the sinner.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is one who makes himself rich, yet has nothing;
    there is one who makes himself poor, yet has great riches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ransom of a man’s life is his riches,
    but the poor does not hear rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the righteous rejoices,
    but the lamp of the wicked will be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only by pride comes contention,
    but with the well-advised is wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth gained by vanity will be diminished,
    but he who gathers by labor will increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hope deferred makes the heart sick,
    but when the desire comes, it is a tree of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever despises the word will be destroyed,
    but he who fears the commandment will be rewarded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The teaching of the wise is a fountain of life,
    to depart from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Good understanding gives favor,
    but the way of transgressors is hard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every prudent man deals with knowledge,
    but a fool lays open his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked messenger falls into mischief,
    but a faithful envoy is health.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Poverty and shame will be to him who refuses instruction,
    but he who regards reproof will be honored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire accomplished is sweet to the soul,
    but it is abomination to fools to depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks with wise men will be wise,
    but a companion of fools will be destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Evil pursues sinners,
    but to the righteous good will be repaid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good man leaves an inheritance to his children’s children,
    and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Much food is in the tillage of the poor,
    but for lack of justice it is destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who spares his rod hates his son,
    but he who loves him disciplines him early.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous eats to the satisfying of his soul,
    but the stomach of the wicked will want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every wise woman builds her house,
    but the foolish pulls it down with her hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who walks in his uprightness fears the Lord,
    but he who is perverse in his ways despises Him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride,
    but the lips of the wise will preserve them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where no oxen are, the crib is clean;
    but much increase is by the strength of the ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A faithful witness will not lie,
    but a false witness will utter lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scorner seeks wisdom and does not find it,
    but knowledge is easy to him who understands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Go from the presence of a foolish man,
    when you do not perceive in him the lips of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way,
    but the folly of fools is deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fools make a mock at sin,
    but among the righteous there is favor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart knows its own bitterness,
    and a stranger does not share its joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The house of the wicked will be overthrown,
    but the tent of the upright will flourish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
    but its end is the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful,
    and the end of that cheer is grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The backslider in heart will be filled with his own ways,
    but a good man will be satisfied with his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple believes every word,
    but the prudent man considers his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man fears and departs from evil,
    but the fool rages and is self-confident.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is quick-tempered deals foolishly,
    and a man of wicked devices is hated.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The simple inherit folly,
    but the prudent are crowned with knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The evil bow before the good,
    and the wicked at the gates of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor is hated even by his own neighbor,
    but the rich has many friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who despises his neighbor sins,
    but he who has mercy on the poor, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do they not err who devise evil?
    But mercy and truth will be to those who devise good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In all labor there is profit,
    but mere talk leads only to poverty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown of the wise is their riches,
    but the foolishness of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A true witness delivers souls,
    but a deceitful witness speaks lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fear of the Lord is strong confidence,
    and His children will have a place of refuge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is a fountain of life,
    to depart from the snares of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the multitude of people is a king’s honor,
    but in the lack of people is the destruction of a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slow to wrath is of great understanding,
    but he who is hasty of spirit exalts folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sound heart is the life of the flesh,
    but envy the rottenness of the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who oppresses the poor reproaches his Maker,
    but he who honors Him has mercy on the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked is driven away in his wickedness,
    but the righteous has hope in his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom rests in the heart of him who has understanding,
    but that which is in the midst of fools is made known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteousness exalts a nation,
    but sin is a reproach to any people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s favor is toward a wise servant,
    but his wrath is against him who causes shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A soft answer turns away wrath,
    but grievous words stir up anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the wise uses knowledge aright,
    but the mouth of fools pours out foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
    keeping watch on the evil and the good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wholesome tongue is a tree of life,
    but perverseness in it crushes the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool despises his father’s instruction,
    but he who regards reproof is prudent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the house of the righteous is much treasure,
    but in the revenue of the wicked is trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips of the wise disperse knowledge,
    but the heart of the foolish does not do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the Lord,
    but the prayer of the upright is His delight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the wicked is an abomination unto the Lord,
    but He loves him who follows after righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Correction is grievous to him who forsakes the way,
    and he who hates reproof will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and destruction are before the Lord;
    so how much more the hearts of the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A scorner does not love one who reproves him,
    nor will he go to the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance,
    but by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge,
    but the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the days of the afflicted are evil,
    but he who is of a merry heart has a continual feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is little with the fear of the Lord
    than great treasure with trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dinner of herbs where love is
    than a fatted calf with hatred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wrathful man stirs up strife,
    but he who is slow to anger appeases strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of the slothful man is as a hedge of thorns,
    but the way of the righteous is made plain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise son makes a father glad,
    but a foolish man despises his mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Folly is joy to him who is destitute of wisdom,
    but a man of understanding walks uprightly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Without counsel, purposes are disappointed,
    but in the multitude of counselors they are established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man has joy by the answer of his mouth,
    and a word spoken in due season, how good it is!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of life leads above for the wise,
    that he may depart from Sheol below.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord will destroy the house of the proud,
    but He will establish the border of the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the wicked are an abomination to the Lord,
    but the words of the pure are pleasant words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is greedy of gain troubles his own house,
    but he who hates bribes will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the righteous studies to answer,
    but the mouth of the wicked pours out evil things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is far from the wicked,
    but He hears the prayer of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light of the eyes rejoices the heart,
    and a good report makes the bones healthy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The ear that hears the reproof of life
    abides among the wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who refuses instruction despises his own soul,
    but he who hears reproof gains understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord is the instruction of wisdom,
    and before honor is humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The preparations of the heart belong to man,
    but the answer of the tongue is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the ways of a man are clean in his own eyes,
    but the Lord weighs the spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Commit your works to the Lord,
    and your thoughts will be established.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord has made all things for Himself,
    yes, even the wicked for the day of evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Everyone who is proud in heart is an abomination to the Lord;
    be assured, he will not be unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By mercy and truth iniquity is purged;
    and by the fear of the Lord men depart from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When a man’s ways please the Lord,
    He makes even his enemies to be at peace with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a little with righteousness
    than great revenues with injustice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s heart devises his way,
    but the Lord directs his steps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A divine sentence is in the lips of the king;
    his mouth does not transgress in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A just weight and balance belong to the Lord;
    all the weights of the bag are His work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is an abomination to kings to commit wickedness,
    for the throne is established by righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Righteous lips are the delight of kings,
    and they love him who speaks right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wrath of a king is as messengers of death,
    but a wise man will pacify it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the light of the king’s countenance is life,
    and his favor is as a cloud of the latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much better to get wisdom than gold!
    And to get understanding is to be chosen rather than silver!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The highway of the upright is to depart from evil;
    he who keeps his way preserves his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pride goes before destruction,
    and a haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better it is to be of a humble spirit with the lowly
    than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who handles a matter wisely will find good,
    and whoever trusts in the Lord, happy is he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wise in heart will be called prudent,
    and the sweetness of the lips increases learning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Understanding is a wellspring of life to him who has it,
    but the instruction of fools is folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the wise teaches his mouth,
    and adds learning to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pleasant words are as a honeycomb,
    sweet to the soul and health to the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is a way that seems right to a man,
    but its end is the way of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who labors, labors for himself,
    for his mouth craves it of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An ungodly man digs up evil,
    and in his lips there is as a burning fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A perverse man sows strife,
    and a whisperer separates the best of friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A violent man entices his neighbor,
    and leads him into the way that is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shuts his eyes to devise perverse things;
    moving his lips he brings evil to pass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The gray-haired head is a crown of glory,
    if it is found in the way of righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty,
    and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot is cast into the lap,
    but the whole outcome is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is a dry morsel with quietness
    than a house full of sacrifices with strife.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise servant will have rule over a son who causes shame,
    and will have part of the inheritance among the brothers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The refining pot is for silver and the furnace for gold,
    but the Lord tries the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked doer gives heed to false lips,
    and a liar gives ear to a wayward tongue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever mocks the poor reproaches his Maker,
    and he who is glad at calamities will not be unpunished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Grandchildren are the crown of old men,
    and the glory of children are their fathers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Excellent speech is not becoming to a fool,
    much less lying lips to a prince.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift is as a precious stone in the eyes of him who has it;
    wherever he turns, it prospers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who covers a transgression seeks love,
    but he who repeats a matter separates friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A reproof enters deeper into a wise man
    than a hundred stripes into a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An evil man seeks only rebellion;
    therefore a cruel messenger will be sent against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let a man meet a bear robbed of her cubs
    rather than a fool in his folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever rewards evil for good,
    evil will not depart from his house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The beginning of strife is as when one lets out water;
    therefore abandon contention before a quarrel starts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who justifies the wicked, and he who condemns the just,
    both of them are abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom,
    seeing he has no heart for it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A friend loves at all times,
    and a brother is born for adversity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man void of understanding shakes hands,
    and becomes a pledge in the presence of his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He loves transgression who loves strife,
    and he who exalts his gate seeks destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has a deceitful heart finds no good,
    and he who has a perverse tongue falls into mischief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who fathers a fool does it to his sorrow,
    and the father of a fool has no joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A merry heart does good like a medicine,
    but a broken spirit dries the bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man takes a bribe out of a hidden place
    to pervert the ways of judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wisdom is before him who has understanding,
    but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is a grief to his father,
    and bitterness to her who bore him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also to punish the just is not good,
    nor to strike princes for their uprightness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has knowledge spares his words,
    and a man of understanding is of an excellent spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a fool, when he holds his peace, is counted wise;
    and he who shuts his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who separates himself seeks his own desire;
    he seeks and quarrels against all wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool has no delight in understanding,
    but in expressing his own heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the wicked comes, then comes also contempt,
    and with dishonor reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a man’s mouth are as deep waters,
    and the wellspring of wisdom as a flowing brook.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not good to favor the wicked,
    or to turn aside the righteous in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s lips enter into contention,
    and his mouth calls for flogging.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A fool’s mouth is his destruction,
    and his lips are the snare of his soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The words of a talebearer are as wounds,
    and they go down into the innermost parts of the body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He also who is slothful in his work
    is brother to him who is a great waster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The name of the Lord is a strong tower;
    the righteous run into it and are safe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich man’s wealth is his strong city,
    and as a high wall in his own conceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before destruction the heart of man is haughty,
    and before honor is humility.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who answers a matter before he hears it,
    it is folly and shame to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of a man will sustain his infirmity,
    but a wounded spirit who can bear?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The heart of the prudent gets knowledge,
    and the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s gift makes room for him,
    and brings him before great men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who is first in his own cause seems just,
    but his neighbor comes and searches him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lot causes contentions to cease,
    and keeps the mighty ones apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A brother offended is harder to be won than a strong city,
    and their contentions are like the bars of a castle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man’s stomach will be satisfied with the fruit of his mouth;
    and with the increase of his lips will he be filled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Death and life are in the power of the tongue,
    and those who love it will eat its fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever finds a wife finds a good thing,
    and obtains favor of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The poor man uses entreaties,
    but the rich man answers roughly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man who has friends must show himself friendly,
    and there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Better is the poor who walks in his integrity
    than he who is perverse in his lips and is a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also, it is not good for the soul to be without knowledge,
    and he who hastens with his feet sins.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The foolishness of man perverts his way,
    and his heart frets against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wealth makes many friends,
    but the poor is separated from his neighbor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not be unpunished,
    and he who speaks lies will not escape.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Many will entreat the favor of the prince,
    and every man is a friend to him who gives gifts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All the brothers of the poor hate him;
    how much more do his friends go far from him!
He pursues them with words,
    yet they abandon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who gets wisdom loves his own soul;
    he who keeps understanding will find good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will not be unpunished,
    and he who speaks lies will perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Delight is not seemly for a fool,
    much less for a servant to have rule over princes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The discretion of a man defers his anger,
    and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion,
    but his favor is as dew upon the grass.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A foolish son is the calamity of his father,
    and the contentions of a wife are a continual dripping of water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
House and riches are the inheritance of fathers,
    and a prudent wife is from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep,
    and an idle soul will suffer hunger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who keeps the commandment keeps his own soul,
    but he who is careless in his ways will die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has pity on the poor lends to the Lord,
    and He will repay what he has given.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Chasten your son while there is hope,
    and let not your soul spare for his crying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A man of great wrath will suffer punishment;
    for if you deliver him, yet you must do it again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear counsel and receive instruction,
    that you may be wise in your latter days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are many plans in a man’s heart,
    nevertheless the counsel of the Lord will stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of a man is his kindness,
    and a poor man is better than a liar.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fear of the Lord tends to life,
    and he who has it will abide satisfied; he will not be visited with evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A slothful man hides his hand in his bowl,
    and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware;
    and reprove one who has understanding, and he will understand knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who mistreats his father and chases away his mother
    is a son who causes shame and brings reproach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cease, my son, to hear the instruction
    that causes to err from the words of knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An ungodly witness scorns judgment,
    and the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Judgments are prepared for scorners,
    and beatings for the back of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging,
    and whoever is deceived by it is not wise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The terror of a king is as the roaring of a lion;
    whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own soul.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is an honor for a man to cease from strife,
    but every fool will be meddling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sluggard will not plow because of the cold;
    therefore he will beg during harvest and have nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Counsel in the heart of man is like deep water,
    but a man of understanding will draw it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Most men will proclaim everyone his own goodness,
    but who can find a faithful man?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The just man walks in his integrity;
    his children are blessed after him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A king who sits on the throne of judgment
    scatters away all evil with his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can say, “I have made my heart clean,
    I am pure from my sin”?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Diverse weights and diverse measures,
    both of them alike are an abomination to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even a child is known by his doings,
    whether his work is pure and whether it is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hearing ear and the seeing eye,
    the Lord has made both of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not love sleep, lest you come to poverty;
    open your eyes, and you will be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“It is bad, it is bad,” says the buyer;
    but when he has gone his way, then he boasts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is gold and a multitude of rubies,
    but the lips of knowledge are a precious jewel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take the garment of him who is a pledge for a stranger,
    and hold it as a security when it is for a wayward woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Bread of deceit is sweet to a man,
    but afterwards his mouth will be filled with gravel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every purpose is established by counsel,
    and with good advice wage war.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who goes about as a talebearer reveals secrets;
    therefore do not meddle with him who flatters with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever curses his father or his mother,
    his lamp will be put out in obscure darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
An inheritance may be gained hastily at the beginning,
    but the end of it will not be blessed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not say, “I will recompense evil”;
    but wait on the Lord, and He will save you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Diverse weights are an abomination to the Lord,
    and a false balance is not good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man’s goings are of the Lord;
    how can a man then understand his own way?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is a snare to the man who dedicates rashly that which is holy,
    and after the vows to make inquiry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise king sifts out the wicked,
    and drives the threshing wheel over them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The spirit of man is the candle of the Lord,
    searching all the inward parts of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mercy and truth preserve the king,
    and his throne is upheld by mercy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The glory of young men is their strength,
    and the beauty of old men is the gray head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blows of a wound cleanse away evil,
    so do stripes the inward parts of the heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The king’s heart is in the hand of the Lord,
    as the rivers of water; He turns it to any place He will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Every way of a man is right in his own eyes,
    but the Lord weighs the hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To do justice and judgment
    is more acceptable to the Lord than sacrifice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A high look, a proud heart,
    and the plowing of the wicked are sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenty,
    but of everyone who is hasty only to want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The getting of treasures by a lying tongue
    is a vanity tossed back and forth by those who seek death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The violence of the wicked will destroy them,
    because they refuse to do justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The way of a guilty man is perverse;
    but as for the pure, his work is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop
    than with a brawling woman in a wide house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The soul of the wicked desires evil;
    his neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the scorner is punished, the simple is made wise;
    and when the wise is instructed, he receives knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous man wisely considers the house of the wicked,
    but God overthrows the wicked for their wickedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever shuts his ears at the cry of the poor,
    he also will cry himself, but will not be heard.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gift in secret pacifies anger,
    and a concealed bribe strong wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is joy to the just to do justice,
    but destruction will come to the workers of iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The man who wanders out of the way of understanding
    will remain in the congregation of the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves pleasure will be a poor man;
    he who loves wine and oil will not be rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked will be a ransom for the righteous,
    and the transgressor for the upright.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is better to dwell in the wilderness
    than with a contentious and angry woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the wise,
    but a foolish man squanders it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who follows after righteousness and mercy
    finds life, righteousness, and honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wise man scales the city of the mighty,
    and casts down the strength of its confidence.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue
    keeps his soul from trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Proud and haughty—scorner is his name,
    who deals in proud wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The desire of the slothful kills him,
    for his hands refuse to labor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He covets greedily all the day long,
    but the righteous gives and does not spare.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination;
    how much more when he brings it with a wicked intent!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A false witness will perish,
    but a man who listens will speak forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A wicked man hardens his face,
    but as for the upright, he directs his way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel
    against the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The horse is prepared against the day of battle,
    but victory is of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches,
    and loving favor rather than silver and gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich and poor have this in common,
    the Lord is the maker of them all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A prudent man foresees the evil and hides himself,
    but the simple pass on and are punished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By humility and the fear of the Lord
    are riches, and honor, and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thorns and snares are in the way of the perverse;
    he who guards his soul will be far from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Train up a child in the way he should go,
    and when he is old he will not depart from it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The rich rules over the poor,
    and the borrower is servant to the lender.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who sows iniquity will reap vanity,
    and the rod of his anger will fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who has a bountiful eye will be blessed,
    for he gives of his bread to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Cast out the scorner, and contention will go out;
    yes, strife and reproach will cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who loves pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips
    the king will be his friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eyes of the Lord preserve knowledge,
    and He overthrows the words of the transgressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The slothful man says, “There is a lion without!
    I will be slain in the streets!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The mouth of an immoral woman is a deep pit;
    he who is detested by the Lord will fall therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child,
    but the rod of correction will drive it far from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He who oppresses the poor to increase his riches,
    and he who gives to the rich, will surely come to want.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Incline your ear and hear the words of the wise,
    and apply your heart to my knowledge;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you;
    they will readily be fitted in your lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That your trust may be in the Lord,
    I have made known to you this day, even to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have I not written to you excellent things
    in counsels and knowledge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
that I might make you know the certainty of the words of truth,
    that you might answer the words of truth
    to those who send to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do not rob the poor because he is poor,
    neither oppress the afflicted in the gate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for the Lord will plead their cause,
    and spoil the soul of those who spoiled them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Make no friendship with an angry man,
    and with a furious man you will not go,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
